basics.name: Stefano Dalla Palma
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary:
A proactive, self-studier, with a strong can-do attitude person motivated by an inexhaustible enthusiasm and commitment and excited to follow-up collaborations with industries working in the Software Engineering domain!
Recently completed the Google Project Management Career Certificate - a rigorous, hands-on program that covers traditional and Agile project management approaches throughout the life cycle of a project.

work.name: Adyen
work.summary: As a Tech Academy Engineer, I design and deliver tailored training for software engineers, mentor juniors, and contribute to Adyen Tech Academy's software development, fostering continuous learning and growth.
highlights: Tailored training on Code Reviews, SOLID principles, and Refactoring to Design Patterns
Developed Adyen Tech Academy's Java web app supporting various company academies
Automation and integration with Google Calendar, Zoom, and Mattermost

courses: Conduced an empirical study on Bounded Model-Checking in security context
Gained familiarity with the bounded model-checker CBMC and analyzed it in distinguish vulnerable code regions
Collected and analyzed corpus of real-world C applications with known vulnerabilities
Implemented program analysis in Python and performed experimentation

references.name: Dr. Earl Barr, Jul 2018 (http://earlbarr.com/)
references.reference: Stefano is an impressive young researcher. He generates his own interesting research ideas and overcomes most engineering obstacles on his own. He has a promising future ahead of him

projects.name: RADON-H2020
projects.description: The project aims at pursuing a broader adoption of serverless computing technologies within the European software industry. One of RADON’s key pillars is quality assurance tools for Infrastructure-as-Code. As part of the RADON framework, the Defect Prediction tool (https://github.com/radon-h2020/radon-defuse) developed during the PhD focuses on IaC correctness. It consists of several components to mine open-source repositories to identify failure data and to extract quality metrics to guide the empirical training and enrichment of the models for defect prediction as well as predict code smells and errors in IaC files. Although instantiated in the context of infrastructure as code, the defect predictor was envisioned and designed to be language-agnostic.
highlights: Developed a tool suite for defect prediction of failure-prone Infrastructure-as-Code files (https://github.com/radon-h2020/radon-defuse)
Conducted empirical research to implement and validate the tool suite
